active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a think-pair-share activity, debate whether Technical Intelligence focused on IoCs (e.g., file hashes) or Tactical Intelligence focused on TTPs (e.g., living-off-the-land techniques) is more valuable for proactive threat hunting. Use examples from recent cyberattacks like SolarWinds or Log4Shell to support your position.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Threat Intelligence. Topic: 'Technical Intelligence' (Level 6 in hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Threat Intelligence And Hunting > 011_Threat Hunting > 005_Cyber Threat Intelligence (CTI) for Hunting > Types of Threat Intelligence > Technical Intelligence). Builds on prior 'Types of Threat Intelligence' subdomain. Core Content (synthesize from research/voters): Technical Intelligence is granular CTI on low-level artifacts (IoCs: IPs/domains/hashes/malware signatures/tools) for detection/blocking. Distinguish: Strategic (trends/executives), Operational (campaigns/IR), Tactical (TTPs/defense). Lifecycle: Requirements > Collection (logs/PCAPs/feeds) > Processing > Analysis > Dissemination > Feedback. MITRE ATT&CK: Maps TTPs across full adversary lifecycle (Reconnaissance, Resource Development, Initial Access, Execution, Persistence, Privilege Escalation, Defense Evasion, Credential Access, Discovery, Lateral Movement, Collection, Command & Control, Exfiltration, Impact). Threat Hunting: Proactive IoC/TTP hunts. Incorporate: - Learning Objectives: [paste full list above] - Active Learning: [reference activities for context/examples] - Scaffolding: Generate cards progressively across 4 layers: [paste layer descriptions]. Use Flashcard Schema: [paste full schema]. Output ONLY a JSON array of 40-60 flashcards. Balance: 25% Layer1/REMEMBER-UNDERSTAND, 25% Layer2/APPLY, 25% Layer3/ANALYZE, 25% Layer4/EVALUATE-CREATE. 40% MCQ, 40% QA, 20% Cloze. Ensure university pedagogy: active recall, spaced repetition, misconceptions addressed. Sources: CrowdStrike, BlueVoyant, MITRE ATT&CK.
